chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Joshua Michael Sandberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/costs to be paid in installments of $100.00 per month.  Payments to be applied first to County Appointed Attorney Fees.
50 days in the Pepin County Jail commencing 03-01-2016 at 12:00 p.m. with work release and credit for 10 days served.  First 48 hours already served since sat 10 straight days.
Submit to and comply with an Alcohol Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.

County Appointed Attorney Fees TBD.  
AMENDED 02-02-2016:  County Appointed Attorney Fees Ordered 12/10/14 to 12/08/15 of $217.00.  County Appointed Attorney Fees Ordered 12/09/15 to 01/27/16 of $315.00 in Case Nos. 2015CF49 and 2015CM30.
Jackson County Case No. 2015CT102 read in.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #2 - Dismissed.  DPA successfully completed.

Now comes Jon D. Seifert, District Atty in and for Pepin Co., on behalf of the S/W and moves the Court for an Order to Dismiss without prejudice to either party.  
The basis for the Motion is that the Defendant has successfully complied with the terms of his Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement.
ORDER:  Motion is granted and Count 2 of 2015CF49 is hereby dismissed w/o prejudice to either party.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua Michael Sandberg in court with attorney Patrick William Waters of SPD office.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Waters requests to be heard on bond.  Court inquires if he qualifies for SPD as Atty Harless showing as counsel on MH case.  Atty Waters notes he qualifies at this moment while in custody.  Atty Waters requests Signature Bond.  State has no objection to modify cash bond to signature bond, dont think the court should remove the alcohol monitoring of the bond.  Court modifies bond to allow either $1000 cash or $1000 signature bond with alcohol monitoring.  On both bonds conditions of no drinking; no bars; reside with your father; no violations of law.  Defendant waives time limits for PH.  Atty Waters informs defendant will no longer qualify for SPD.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua Michael Sandberg in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties, constitutional rights and right to a preliminary hearing within 10 days if in custody, 20 days if not.  State notes defendant engaged with court in DPA; request cash bond, conduct fail to comply with law enforcement and did this while under a DPA, cash bond necessary and ask $1000 cash; if he makes cash bond, ask condition of release be subject to twice a day monitoring.  Court sets cash bond as requested; conditions if make bond:  be on an approved alcohol monitoring device like VICAP, let the jail know if interested; no possession or consumption of alcohol, no entry into bars or taverns, no other violations of law.  Advised of right to attorney, contact the PD office.  Waive time limits, set cont'd INIT.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
